09:57 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
09:58 <DarkKnightCZ> is there a way how to invoke export of multiple pages outside GET parameter? (this fails due to max url length)  
09:59 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: XAR export ?  
09:59 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: yes, xar export  
10:00 <tmortagne> depends on your version, it support some regex in recent version  
10:00 <tmortagne> checking which one exatly  
10:00 <DarkKnightCZ> i think it was added in 6.3 (running 6.2.1)  
10:01 <tmortagne> yep 6.3  
10:01 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:01 <DarkKnightCZ> ha, got it, you can send it as post  
10:01 <tmortagne> now it does not have to be GET request  
10:02 <DarkKnightCZ> exactly :)  
10:02 <tmortagne> post would probably bahave exatly the same way  
10:02 <tmortagne> on server side it does not make any difference  
10:10 <lucaa> has quit  
10:11 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki

11:29 <gdelhumeau> [ANN] Restarting xwiki.org in 10minutes

11:30 <gdelhumeau> I want to add an extension repository  
11:30 <gdelhumeau> in xwiki.properties  
11:30 <vmassol> wait

14:58 <vmassol> mflorea, gdelhumeau: I'd like to start the move of the test modules into the tools directories (see my last mail on devs). Please let me know if you agree  
15:00 <gdelhumeau> +1 I'll probably need this package too to put my maven plugin that copy the XAR dependencies into the data folder  
15:28 <msmeria> has quit  
15:32 <vmassol> tmortagne: you removed some wiki pages for the lucene move, does it mean we lost them?  
15:32 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
15:33 <vmassol> WikisSuggestLuceneService.xml  
15:33 <vmassol> shouldn't it be moved too to contrib?  
15:33 <tmortagne> no idea where to put them (don't even understand what it was doing is a module that does not have anything to do with Lucene...)  
15:34 <vmassol> what I hope is that a user can add the lucene search module from the EM and get exactly the same thing as he does now  
15:34 <gsmeria> has quit  
15:34 <vmassol> (we might have users still depending on lucene)  
15:35 <tmortagne> no I don't think just putting the lucene module will work exactly as it used to since there was hardcoded hack for lucene module I just removed since they don't make much sense anymore to keep for a module which is not supported anymore  
15:37 <tmortagne> I made sure that a module using lucene plugin won't be broken but I don't see the point in keeping lucene module related hack for the general search UI  
15:37 <vmassol> yes I think I agree  
15:41 <vmassol> someone broke xwiki-commons  
15:41 <vmassol> one test in the velocity module is failing now with a NPE (at lest locally)  
15:41 <vmassol> seems jenkins has noticed it too: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-commons/  
15:42 <tmortagne> yep saw it but I don't understand why exactly yet, loooks like some velocity code is trying to parse a null URL  
15:42 <tmortagne> not sure why is was working before  
15:42 <vmassol> httpclient regression or change of behavior it seems...  
15:43 <tmortagne> it's possible but it does not make much sense to parse a null URL  
15:44 <tmortagne> not supporting parsing a null URL is not a big regression for me, we should try to understand why this parameter ends up null  
15:44 <vmassol> it would be better to still support null at the level of our tool  
15:44 <vmassol> (since it's a velocity tool)  
15:44 <vmassol> not hard to do  
15:48 <tmortagne> I see this test job is specifically to test passing null and looks like it was counting on httpclient for this  
15:53 <martin-h> has quit  
15:53 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
15:57 <vmassol> mflorea: anything against XWIKI-11743 ? (I'm ready to commit ;))  
15:58 <mflorea> give me a minute  
15:58 <vmassol> k  
16:01 <mflorea> vmassol: +1  
16:06 <vmassol> mflorea: ok thanks

16:45 <vrachieru> has quit  
16:52 <RamonaConoro> has quit  
17:00 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
17:08 <woshilapin> Hi devs, a small question that I'm asking myself about script services  
17:09 <woshilapin> Why does the Script Service components are not implementing the API?  
17:09 <woshilapin> Since usually, all the functions are supported?  
17:09 <woshilapin> I'm almost sure I'm missing something here but I can't have it clear in my mind...  
17:09 <vmassol> our component system only allows implementing one api  
17:10 <woshilapin> (for example, XWikiManagerScriptService implements ScriptService but not XWikiManager)  
17:10 <vmassol> it should implement the business interface  
17:10 <woshilapin> Ah, ok, this is a technical limitation then  
17:11 <vmassol> but it's registered against the CM under the ScriptService role  
17:11 <woshilapin> I was not expecting this kind of answer :-P  
17:11 <tmortagne> also usually script service job is to check for rights before colling the actual API  
17:11 <tmortagne> s/colling/calling/  
17:12 <woshilapin> tmortagne: What you mean is that it's not exactly the same purpose (and then, in a design point of view, it should not implement)?  
17:13 <woshilapin> even if in reality, almost all functions are reproduce  
17:13 <tmortagne> what I mean is that script service job is supposed to be a script oriented filter in front of the actual API, being related to right or error management which are a bit different in script usually etc  
17:13 <woshilapin> (I didn't make an exhaustive check !)  
17:14 <tmortagne> the method are reproduce of many of them have right tests you don't want internally  
17:14 <vmassol> woshilapin: the siganture are not the same if that's what you mean  
17:14 <vmassol> \*signatures  
17:14 <vmassol> my answer was on a different level  
17:14 <vmassol> I'm not sure what you're asking precsiely :)  
17:14 <woshilapin> Yes, both of the answers interest me  
17:15 <woshilapin> I think, indirectly, you answer my question  
17:15 <vmassol> for example:  
17:15 <vmassol> WikiManager  
17:15 <vmassol> is a Java API  
17:15 <vmassol> not a scripting API  
17:15 <woshilapin> Yes, but I don't see the difference  
17:15 <vmassol> for example  
17:15 <vmassol> the java api will throw exceptions  
17:15 <vmassol> the scripting API won't  
17:15 <vmassol> it'll return null  
17:15 <woshilapin> Yes, but Velocity can catch them too now, right?  
17:16 <vmassol> yes it can but it's not how we implemented the contracts so far and we haven't changed that  
17:16 <vmassol> another example  
17:17 <vmassol> in velocity we cannot do a new  
17:17 <vmassol> so we can have some params that are hard to construct from velocity  
17:17 <vmassol> and we need a different ways of passing them  
17:17 <vmassol> (different signature)  
17:17 <vmassol> we usually try to have soe automatic converters for that  
17:17 <vmassol> \*some  
17:17 <vmassol> what you can do is check the mail sender api  
17:18 <vmassol> that we have introduced recently  
17:18 <vmassol> you'll see it's compltely different from the Java API  
17:18 <vmassol> because what you can do in Java is different from how you express things easily in velocity  
17:18 <vmassol> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Mail+Sender+API  
17:19 <woshilapin> Thanks, I think this can help me to understand  
17:20 <woshilapin> I was mainly looking into the WikiManager for now  
17:20 <woshilapin> OK, thanks tmortagne and vmassol, I will not lose too many of your time, thanks for the answers  
17:20 <vmassol> yw  
17:20 <tmortagne> woshilapin: you have a lot of right checking in WikiManagerScriptService  
17:21 <woshilapin> tmortagne: Yes, but the signature are almost the same  
17:21 <tmortagne> the signature yes but the behavior is not  
17:21 <tmortagne> so it can't be the same implementation  
17:32 <gsmeria> has quit
